creator: MikeKulls
title: Running 3 monitors by installing second PCI Express card
materials_required: Dremel with mini angle grinder blade (or full size grinder or hacksaw)
description: This project details how to install a second video card into a 1x PCI Express slot to enable the use of 3 or more monitors on a PC. This is achieved by modifying a 16x PCI Express card to fit the smaller slot.
steps: Obtain a PCI Express video card.
Mark the pins to be cut off, leaving the first 7 pins of the larger section intact.
Cut the pins off the card using a Dremel with a mini angle grinder blade. Create a notch near the 7th pin and cut off the lug towards the back of the card for clearance.
Clean up the edges of the cut using a razor blade, screw driver or kitchen knife to remove any metal fragments.
Install the modified card into the PCI Express 1x slot. Take precaution to ensure it doesn't contact anything metal, using electrical tape if necessary.
Connect a monitor to the modified card and power on the computer to test if it works.
If the card works, shut off the computer and install the main video card.
Connect the remaining monitors to the video cards.
